name: insolvent
content:

(especially of a company) not having enough money to pay debts, buy goods, etc. Opposite
solvent
Related word
insolvency
Add to word list
Add to word list
(esp. of a company) unable to pay what you owe because you do not have enough money: When it discovered the loans could not be repaid, the bank became insolvent.

FINANCE, ACCOUNTING, LAW not having enough money to pay debts, buy goods, etc.: be/become/be declared insolvent This May the firm was declared insolvent and its operations were shut down. Currently, companies must be insolvent in order to go into administration. The bank was technically insolvent - it listed assets of $16.5 million and liabilities of $18.5 million. Compare
solvent
